CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Photovoltaic |

Note: In the given paragraph, there is only one material-related term "Photovoltaic", which refers to a type of material or technology used in converting light into electricity.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Photovoltaic |

Note: In the given paragraph, there is only one material-related term "Photovoltaic", which refers to a type of material or technology used in converting light into electricity. Other terms like "I SD", "W", "2L", "C i", "μ", "V G", and "V T" are not material names.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| I SD |
| W |
| L |
| C i |
| μ |
| V G |
| V T |

Note: I SD, W, L, C i, μ, V G, and V T are identified as "Property Name" entities in the given paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Upon closer examination, the paragraph seems to only contain one potential material property:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| μ (μ is the mobility of charge carriers in a material, which is a material property) |

The other entities (I SD, W, L, C i, V G, and V T) are more likely to be variables, parameters, or physical quantities in a formula, rather than material properties.
